generif.text: Co-localises with the interstitial TTAGGG repeats in interstitial telomeres.
Down-regulation of TRF1, TRF2 and TIN2 genes is important to maintain telomeric DNA for gastric cancers.
TIN2 alters the conformation of TRF1, which favours a tertiary telomeric structure that hinders telomerase from gaining access to telomeres
Partial knockdown of TIN2 by small hairpin RNA in a telomerase-positive cell line resulted in telomere elongation, which is typical of reduced TRF1 function.
TIN2 mutants defective in binding of TRF1 or TRF2 induce a DNA damage response and destabilize TRF1 and TRF2 at telomeres in human cells.
TIN2 binds TRF1 and TRF2 simultaneously and stabilizes the TRF2 complex on telomeres
May be involved in multistep hepatocarcinogenesis by playing crucial role in telomere shortening.
a novel extra-telomeric organization of TIN2 is associated with the control of cell proliferation; TIN2 is an important regulator of mammary epithelial differentiation
coordinated interactions among TPP1, TIN2, TRF1, and TRF2 may ensure robust assembly of the telosome, telomere targeting of its subunits, and, ultimately, regulated telomere maintenance
TINF2, a component of the shelterin telomere protection complex, is mutated in dyskeratosis congenita.
Results suggest that distinct TIN2 complexes exist and that TIN2-15C-sensitive subcomplexes are particularly important for cell survival in the absence of functional p53.
In a large series, TINF2 mutations account for approximately 11% of all patients with dyskeratosis congenita.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

conclude that a significant proportion of patients who underwent unrelated donor hematopoietic stem cell transplantation for severe aplastic anemia harbored mutations in TINF2 and may have had occult dyskeratosis congenita
Our results suggest a dual role for TIN2 in mediating the function of the shelterin complex and tethering telomeres to the nuclear matrix.
The expression of TINF2 may work to reduce the telomere length in precancerous lesions and offer new insight into the mechanism of carcinogenesis in gastric cancer.
TIN2-anchored TPP1 plays a major role in the recruitment of telomerase to telomeres in human cells.
exon 6 of TINF2 natural mutations in 2/142 Japanese patients with acquired acquired bone marrow failure syndromes
TINF2 mutation of shelterin complex is associated with dyskeratosis congenita.
Frameshift or nonsense mutations in TIN2 gene having very short telomeres are found in patients with dyskeratosis congenita.

Mouse gene deletion experiments revealed DNA-damage-response pathways that threaten chromosome ends and how the components of the telomeric shelterin complex prevent activation of these pathways.[Shelterin]

The presence of dysfunctional telomeres in chronic lymphocytic leukemia did not correlate with telomere shortening or chromatin marks deregulation but with a down-regulation of 2 shelterin genes: ACD and TINF2.
Results suggests that the disruption of TIN2-TRF1 interaction may contribute to the severe dyskeratosis congenita phenotype observed in the context of the TIN2 truncation mutation.
TIN2 mutations in DC may compromise the telomere recruitment of telomerase, leading to telomere shortening and the associated pathogenesis.
These results demonstrate the important roles that Sp1 and NF-kappaB play in regulating the expression of the human telomere-binding protein TIN2.
The positive correlation between telomere length in dyskeratosis congenital and percent of LINE-1 methylation was restricted to TINF2 mutations.
Siah2 acts as an E3 ligase to directly ubiquitylate TIN2 in vitro.
results suggest a link between telomeric proteins (TIN2)and metabolic control, providing an additional mechanism by which telomeric proteins regulate cancer and aging
A potential mitotic regulation of TIN2 by phosphorylation, is reported.

Our findings identify TINF2 as a mutant telomere gene in familial pulmonary fibrosis and suggest that infertility may precede the presentation of pulmonary fibrosis in a small subset of adults with telomere syndromes

telomerase elongates telomeres at a reduced frequency in TIN2-R282H heterozygous cells; this recruitment defect is further corroborated by examining the effect of this mutation on telomerase-telomere co-localization.

data supports a mechanism whereby telomerase deficiency and subsequent shortened telomeres initiate a DNA damage response and create a pro-oxidant environment, especially in Dyskeratosis Congenita cells carrying TINF2 mutations

We report ophthalmic findings in twins with Revesz syndrome due to a previously unreported mutation in TINF2 and propose that phenotypic and molecular overlaps between DKC spectrum disorders and pediatric retinal vasculopathies may reflect a shared pathophysiologic basis.
demonstrate here the presence of a novel spliced isoform of TIN2 in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), related to deletion of exon 2 in the TIN2 gene

study suggests that, gallstone does not affect telomere length and even after having increased telomere length, decreased expression of some shelterin genes in inflamed tissue might cause telomeres to cap improperly, possibly leading to telomere dysfunction and further, gallbladder carcinogenesis
The TIN2 plays an important role in maintaining the stable shelterin complex required for proper telomere end protection.
In TRF1-TIN2-TRF2 complex, the peptide enhances the protein-protein interactions to yield a stable heterodimer
The C-Terminal Extension Unique to the Long Isoform of the Shelterin Component TIN2 Enhances Its Interaction with TRF2 in a Phosphorylation- and Dyskeratosis Congenita Cluster-Dependent Fashion.
Loss of RNA-binding protein HuR facilitates cellular senescence through posttranscriptional regulation of TIN2 mRNA.

Authors found that TPP1(ACD) upon binding to TIN2 induces changes that expand TIN2 binding capacity, such that TIN2 can accommodate both TRF1 and TRF2 simultaneously. Authors suggest a molecular model that explains why ACD is essential for the stable formation of TRF1-TIN2-TRF2 core complex.

All of the TIN2 isoforms stimulated telomerase to similar extents. Mutations in the TPP1 TEL patch abrogated this stimulation, suggesting that TIN2 functions with TPP1/POT1 to stimulate telomerase processivity.
A Truncating Germline Mutation of TINF2 in Individuals with Thyroid Cancer or Melanoma Results in Longer Telomeres.
Acute depletion of telomerase components DKC1 and NOP10 induces oxidative stress and disrupts ribosomal biogenesis via NPM1 and activation of the P53 pathway.
TINF2 is a haploinsufficient tumor suppressor that limits telomere length.
Structure, dynamics, and regulation of TRF1-TIN2-mediated trans- and cis-interactions on telomeric DNA.
Pulmonary fibrosis in dyskeratosis congenita: a case report with a PRISMA-compliant systematic review.
Truncating TINF2 p.Tyr312Ter variant and inherited breast cancer susceptibility.
Phosphorylation of TRF2 promotes its interaction with TIN2 and regulates DNA damage response at telomeres.
eIF3i promotes colorectal cancer cell survival via augmenting PHGDH translation.
TINF2 is a major susceptibility gene in Danish patients with multiple primary melanoma.

Inhibition of DNA recombination at telomere

summary: This gene encodes one of the proteins of the shelterin, or telosome, complex which protects telomeres by allowing the cell to distinguish between telomeres and regions of DNA damage. The protein encoded by this gene is a critical part of shelterin; it interacts with the three DNA-binding proteins of the shelterin complex, and it is important for assembly of the complex. Mutations in this gene cause dyskeratosis congenita (DKC), an inherited bone marrow failure syndrome. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2010].
